thread.title: Flying Queens picked to win SAC
thread.title_full: Flying Queens picked to win SAC

author: KCBD Staff
title: Flying Queens picked to win SAC
text:
Flying Queens picked to win SAC Posted: kcbdstaff@kcbd.com 
Provided by Wayland Baptist Athletics 
The Wayland Baptist Flying Queens are picked to win the Sooner Athletic Conference, according to a preseason poll of head coaches. 
The Flying Queens received seven of 10 first-place votes and finished with 98 points, just ahead of two-time defending NAIA champion Oklahoma City University, which drew the other three first-place votes and polled second with 91 points. 
"We're honored," WBU coach Alesha Robertson-Ellis said of the first-place prediction. "It's a huge compliment to be picked at the top of such a great conference, and we're going to work hard to be there at the end of the season." 
In Robertson-Ellis' second year at the helm, Wayland finished last season with a No. 22 ranking and a 19-12 record, having advanced to the NAIA National Tournament for the second straight season. This year, the Flying Queens are expected to be led by a pair of NAIA All-Americans in seniors Stephanie Afunugo, the reigning SAC Co-Defensive Player of the Year who was WBU's top scorer a year ago averaging 13.7 points per game, and Laura Castillo, an All-SAC First-Teamer who averaged 13.2 ppg. Another starter back is junior guard Shawna Monreal. 
Other veterans returning are Shayla Monreal, back after sitting out last season with an injury, Nina Sato, Regan Hestand, Gabby Gonzales and Jada Riley. Newcomers are Jade Jones, Brianna Bogard, Krystal Forthan and Maci Merket. 
The remainder of the teams in the poll were Texas Wesleyan in third with 78 points, Mid-America Christian in fourth with 72, John Brown in fifth with 69 and Science and Arts in sixth at 51. The final teams were Southwestern Christian in seventh with 50 points, Southwestern Assemblies of God in eighth with 40 points and St. Gregory's in ninth with 26 points. Conference newcomer Bacone was voted 10th with 24 points. 
The Flying Queens unofficially open their season by hosting Midland College in a scrimmage at 2 p.m. Saturday in Hutcherson Center before going to West Texas A&M for another scrimmage on Nov. 5. Wayland's official season-opener is Nov. 10 at home against University of the Southwest (Hobbs, N.M.) 
SAC teams will use a double round-robin scheduling model, in which each team plays a home and away match against each of the other teams. The final regular-season standings will determine the seedings for the conference post-season tournament scheduled for March 2-5, 2015 in Waxahachie on the campus of Southwestern Assemblies of God University. 
2015-16 SAC Women's Basketball Pre-Season Poll 
1. Wayland Baptist
